caption: This photograph captures a dense section of a forest, predominantly featuring snow-covered coniferous trees. These trees are closely packed and the branches prominently display a heavy dusting of snow, emphasizing a wintry, chilly atmosphere. The trees are dark green, contrasting sharply with the white snow, which highlights the texture of the branches. The backdrop is near uniform, consisting of the darkened silhouettes of further distant trees, which enhances the depth of the scene. The lighting is subdued, likely indicating either an overcast day or a shaded area within the forest, contributing to the serene and somewhat somber mood of the image. The overall composition focuses closely on the tree details, filling the frame without showing the sky or ground, directing the viewer's attention solely to the snow-adorned foliage.
title: Sunlit branches of a hemlock tree growing in timberland on vancouver island, british Columbia.  Photo taken near port alberni, british Columbia, canada.  From the environmental protection agencys project documerica collection, "in praise of forests".  For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213.  Entheos.  Summer, 1973.
